subclassFeature.name: Way of the Dragon
entries: Monks of the Way of the Dragon study and idolize draconic beings. They fight like dragons.

subclassFeature.name: Dragonheart
entries: You can speak, read, and write Draconic. Choose one type of dragon for your dragonheart. Your dragonheart is used by features you gain later.

subclassFeature.name: Dragon Style
entries: At 3rd level, you weave dragon-like motions into your martial arts. You gain the following benefits:

items: When you use Step of the Wind, you gain a flying speed equal to your walking speed. This benefit works only in short bursts; you fall if you end your turn in the air and nothing else is holding you aloft.

When you use Patient Defense, parts of your skin become covered by a thin sheen of dragon-like scales. You gain temporary hit points equal to your Wisdom modifier that last until the start of your next turn.
When you use Flurry of Blows, you can change the damage type of your unarmed strikes to that of your dragonheart.
As a reaction to taking damage of the same type as your dragonheart, you can spend 1 ki to cast {@spell absorb elements} at its lowest level.

subclassFeature.name: Breath Weapon
entries: At 6th level, you learn to release a powerful breath attack. You can spend up to 3 ki points and use your action to exhale destructive energy. Your dragonheart determines the size, shape, and damage type of the exhalation.

When you use your breath weapon, each creature in the area of the exhalation must make a saving throw, the type of which is determined by your dragonheart. A creature takes 2 Martial Arts dice of damage for each ki point spend on a failed save, and half as much damage on a successful one.
The maximum number of ki you can expend increase to 4 at 9th level, 5 at 13th level, and 6 at 17th level.

subclassFeature.name: Frightening Presence
entries: At 11th level, you gain the ability to mimic a dragon's terrifying roar. When you use Flurry of Blows, you can replace one attack with a draconic roar to force each creature of your choice that you can see within 30 feet of you to make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, a creature becomes frightened of you for 1 minute. The frightened creature can repeat this saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a creature's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to this effect for the next 24 hours.

subclassFeature.name: Legendary Reaction
entries: By 17th level you have taken upon the aspect of a true dragon. You move with nearly unmatched grace and speed. When a creature other than you ends it's turn you can use your reaction to do one of the following:

items: {@bold Detect.} You make a Wisdom (Perception) check.
{@bold Attack.} You spend 1 ki point to make a melee weapon attack.

{@bold Wing Attack.} While your dragon wings are out, you can spend 2 ki points perform a wing attack. All Large or smaller creatures within 10 ft. of you must succeed a Dexterity saving throw or take damage equal to your unarmed strike and be knocked prone. You can then move up to half your flying speed.
